intro: Sebastiania panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, orange-red flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as tropical forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
